page.title: 19Religion.St.Andrew's, Sandon
page.content: {St.Andrew's Church,}which is{900}years old,stands in its well_kept churchyard overlooking the village green. The nave is{Norman.}Extensions were added to the Church and the north aisle in 1350.The hammer beam ceiling and wagon roof in the chancel are 15th century. The arch of the south door is 14th century. The massive tower and porch are probably the work of Giralano de Trevise, builder of{Hampton Court, which was inaugurated by{Cardinal {Wolsey,}who was also Lord of Sandon Manor. The wooden pedestal{pulpit,}the finest of its kind in Essex, dates from Henry VII. The stone font is 16th century. A{medieval pax}"a kiss of peace", one of St. Andrew's treasured possessions,dates from 1500 and is one of only two wooden varieties known. The painting of St.Andrew's was a gift from artist Lynton Lamb.
